revised_title: Lead and Oxygen Isotopes in Archaeological Materials: Applications in Ancient Glass and Art
tldr: This article discusses the use of lead and oxygen isotopes in ancient materials to study the origins of ores and ingredients used in archaeological objects, particularly ancient glass and art. By analyzing the isotopic composition of lead and oxygen in these materials, researchers can determine the possible geographical origins of the ores and materials used, aiding in the understanding of ancient trade networks and the authentication of artworks.
